summary.para: Identifies an object in an alpha development state.
Such an object should not be used for production purpose
because its implementation could be incomplete and/or its
interface could completely change in future releases.
Identifies an object in a beta development state.
Such an object should preferably not be used for production purpose
because its implementation could still contain major issues.
The interface of the object should be pretty stable even if very minor

member.name: T:Ion.Core.DevelopmentStepAttribute
member.summary: Identifies a development step in an object or interface development

member.name: P:Ion.Core.DevelopmentStepAttribute.Comment
member.summary: Whatever comment on this object status

member.name: P:Ion.Core.DevelopmentStepAttribute.Version
member.summary: Component current version

member.name: P:Ion.Core.DevelopmentStepAttribute.Author
member.summary: The author of the class

summary.para: Identifies an object in a production development state.
A production object has already gone through one or more QA session
so to provide a production quality.
The interface of a produciton object is expected to be stable, even
if it can be extended with non-breaking new features in future release.

member.name: T:Ion.Core.Compression.GZipStream
member.summary: Provides methods and properties used to compress and decompress streams.

member.name: M:Ion.Core.Compression.GZipStream.CreateDecompress(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Decompresses the underlying stream.
member.remarks: By default, GZipStream owns the underlying stream, so closing the stream parameter also closes the underlying stream. Note that the state of the underlying stream can affect the usability of the stream. Also, no explicit checks are performed, so no additional exceptions are thrown when the new instance is created.
member.param: true to leave the stream object open after disposing the GZipStream object; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Ion.Core.Perf.PerformanceTimer
member.summary: High resolution timer class that traces named events in the logs.
member.remarks: Use performance timers to create named sections in the log files to trace START/STOP sections, with support of intermediate steps.

member.summary: The log producer key

member.summary: Build the timer, immediately taking the start time

The log producer name of which the level will be used to log

member.name: T:Ion.Core.Perf.SectionProfiler
member.summary: High-performance timers and statistics based on CPU's rdtsc (on desktop platform)

member.name: M:Ion.Core.Perf.SectionProfiler.Enter
member.summary: Called when entering a performance counted section

member.name: T:Ion.Core.Perf.SectionProfiler.Tick
member.summary: Opaque implementation-independent representation of the smallest time period measureable.
member.remarks: On WPF/Desktop/Win this is the RDTSC reading. On Silverlight this should follow the base Windows timer resolution (~13 ms).

member.name: M:Ion.Core.Perf.SectionProfiler.Exit
member.summary: Called when exiting a performance counted section
member.returns: The elapsed RDTSC tick between the Enter call, or 0 if no Enter was called

member.name: M:Ion.Core.Perf.SectionProfiler.Reset
member.summary: Reset the counter

member.summary: Get the cumulated time in ticks
member.exception: When a profiling is current in progress.

member.summary: Get the cumulated time
member.exception: When a profiling is current in progress.

member.summary: Get the 'now' time in ticks

member.name: T:Ion.Core.Data_Silverlight
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:Ion.Core.Data_Silverlight.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:Ion.Core.Data_Silverlight.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:Ion.Core.Data_Silverlight.datepatterns
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-16"?> <CultureInfos xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <culture name="ar-SA"> <pat>dd/MM/yy</pat> <pat>dd/MM/yyyy</pat> <pat>dd/MMMM/yyyy</pat> <pat>dddd, dd MMMM, yyyy</pat> <pat>dd MMMM</pat> <pat>MMMM, yyyy</pat> </culture> <culture name="bg-BG"> <pat>d.M.yyyy '.'</pat> <pat>dd.M.yyyy '.'</pat> <pat>d.MM.yyyy '.'</pat> <pat>dd.MM.yyyy '.'</pat> [rest of string was truncated]";.

member.name: P:Ion.Core.Data_Silverlight.timepatterns
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <CultureInfos xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <culture name="ar-SA"> <pat>hh:mm tt</pat> <pat>HH:mm</pat> <pat>hh:mm:ss tt</pat> <pat>HH:mm:ss</pat> </culture> <culture name="bg-BG"> <pat>HH:mm '.'</pat> <pat>H:mm '.'</pat> <pat>HH:mm:ss '.'</pat> <pat>H:mm:ss '.'</pat> </culture> <culture name="ca-ES"> <pat>HH:mm</pat> <pat>H:mm</pa [rest of string was truncated]";.

member.name: T:Ion.Tools.IonVersion
member.summary:
Represents a Ion-style version. Instances of this class are immutable.
Supported formatting specifications:
E: extended full version, like ToFriendlyString() - 101b4 (Build 5) C: compact full version - 101b4d5 S: short version - 101b4

member.name: F:Ion.Tools.IonVersion.Zero
member.summary: Get the zero (null) version

member.name: T:Ion.Tools.IonVersion.InvalidVersionException
member.summary: Summary description for VersionInvalidException.

member.name: T:Ion.Tools.IonVersion.ReleaseTypeEnum
member.summary: Type of ION version release

member.name: M:Ion.Tools.IonVersion.#ctor(System.Version)
member.summary: Constructor with system version.
member.remarks:
A system version is packed like this:
OLD STYLE 2.3.0.102
where: 2 is the Major version 3 is Middle 0 is Minor 102 is b2 (100 for beta, 2 for stage)
NEW STYLE (v1) 2.130.12350.102
where: 2 is the Major version 130 is Middle (3) and Minor version (0). 100 is to distinguish from older versions. 102 is b2 (100 for beta, 2 for stage) 12350 is the build number
NEWER STYLE (v2) 2.230.102.12350
where: 2 is the Major version 230 is Middle (3) and Minor version (0). 200 is to distinguish from older versions. 102 is b2 (100 for beta, 2 for stage) 12350 is the build number

member.name: M:Ion.Tools.IonVersion.ToString
member.summary:
Supported formatting specifications:
E: extended full version, like ToFriendlyString() - 101b4 (Build 5) C: compact full version - 101b4d5 S: short version - 101b4

member.name: M:Ion.Tools.IonVersion.ToString(System.String,System.IFormatProvider)
member.summary:
Supported formatting specifications:
E: extended full version, like ToFriendlyString() - 101b4 (Build 5) C: compact full version - 101b4d5 S: short version - 101b4

member.name: M:Ion.Tools.IonVersion.ToFriendlyString
member.summary: Returns a user-friendly representation of the version, with the build number separated from the signficant version. Examples: "100p1 (build 24)", "106 (build 20)"

member.name: M:Ion.Tools.IonVersion.GetSystemVersion(Ion.Tools.SystemVersionCodification)
member.summary: Encode with new system

member.name: M:Ion.Tools.IonVersion.ChangeBuildNumber(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a new version with a different build number

member.name: T:Ion.Tools.SystemVersionCodification
member.summary: Enumerate the different ION version codification on 4-digit MS style.
member.remarks:
A system version is packed like this:
OLD STYLE (Version0) 2.3.0.102
where: 2 is the Major version 3 is Middle 0 is Minor 102 is b2 (100 for beta, 2 for stage)
NEW STYLE (Version1) (buggy) 2.130.12350.102
where: 2 is the Major version 130 is Middle (3) and Minor version (0). 100 is to distinguish from older versions. 102 is b2 (100 for beta, 2 for stage) 12350 is the build number
NEW STYLE (Version2) 2.230.102.12350
where: 2 is the Major version 230 is Middle (3) and Minor version (0). 200 is to distinguish from older versions. 102 is b2 (100 for beta, 2 for stage) 12350 is the build number
